item.title: Run a DIY Annual Home Value Audit
item.description: Most homeowners only think about property value when they list or refinance. By then, the clock is ticking, paperwork is scattered, and deferred maintenance suddenly feels urgent. A yearly home value audit flips that script. Spending a weekend reviewing data, documentation, and property condition keeps you equity-ready all year. Lenders, agents, and buyers respond quickly when you show that your numbers are current and your home is cared for. Here is a structured audit you can follow every twelve months—or after major improvements—for a calmer, data-driven approach.
